subject: RE: [junit] Three diverse questions about testing
msgSnippet: ... Because with dynamic class loading you can t tell what a message will do (you don t know the actual class of an object) until the object is instantiated.
messageBody:
> Next he writes about branch coverage and cyclomatic complexity. He
> writes that counting the branches is difficult if the message which
> is sent is polymorph. (Page 156)
>
> 2. I understand this to this point. But then he writes that the
> counting of branches is impossible if dynamic class loading is
> allowed. Why is it impossible then?

Because with dynamic class loading you can't tell what a message will do
(you don't know the actual class of an object) until the object is
instantiated.


> Another thing I don't understand is the a solution to the problem
> with the Square class which extends the Rectangle class.
>
> The problem arises if a method "stretchX(int factor)" is added to
> the Rectangle class. Then you can override it in the Square class
> (so that Y is stretched too with the factor). But then a Square
> instance cannot be used everywhere where a Rectangle instance is can
> be used.
>
> He has three solution for this: reversing the extends relationship,
> extracting a common super class and introducing a value semantics
> ("Wertesemantik").
>
> 3. How does a solution look like with value semantics? I'm not sure
> if I translated the word correctly.

I guess he thinks of immutable objects here - stretchX wouldn't change
the original square, but would return a newly created rectangle.

Regards, Ilja
